Posts.Content: May 3, 2011 04:01AM melania wrote: Thank you so much my dearest friends , It's almost 1 am and i just came to check this board and get  my inspiration for tomorrow. I am glad that u all feel better , AliT , I had lots of chemo before surgery , my onc is also ver aggressive and i am very happy about it , i had 4 rounds of FEC by which my tumor was gone already and he told me that i can do my surgery at that time and then have the rest of the chemo which was THC but the surgeon recommended to wait until the chemo is done , i mean i could do it either ways but they didnt want me to get a break of chemo because of the surgery , because i was also doing reconstruction, anyway i dont think its a bad thing to have your rest of chemo after the surgery , we have to do all we can right? ok girls wish me luck for tomorrow bye and thanks
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: May 8, 2011 03:53PM melania wrote: Hey girls , hope everybody is doing well , thanks for all your support , I was a May girl but i also posted here to get your support and now i post an update about myself: I am 5 days post surgery and doing good , i am home with hubby and my 4 year old daughter, I am taking easy and the only complains is the pain , i have to take my vicodin on time otherwise is killing me , will this pain go away one day???i was just thinking that chemo was easier for me than the surgery , maybe because i dont know that this pain will go away and when? I can walk and sit and read and type and etc  but i cant do things which needs to stretch your hands or ligt anything , i cant open the medicine bottles or water , anyway this too shall pass hopefully !! i was always thinking that i cant wear a bra and i will have big abnadages over my breast and all i need is a bagy shirt with buttons infront ! WRONG , cuz they gave ma a bra which looks like a sport bra but opens and closes in front and is so tight that if i open i can not close it again . The ps told me it should be tight and when u go home u can wear a sport bra. i think my surgeons did a great job, my breasts still look like my breasts ! maybe because i was a small chested girl , i was A cup and i have tissue expanders put at the time of mastectomy and will start the fills after radiation, but even now it looks better than my original breasts , the only thing missing is the nipples , I am happy with the look part so hopefully the path report will come out clear either. I have 2 questions: 1) I was  wondering since when did u start driving after surgery? Is this ok if someone else drives you to the shopping mall and u do some shopping but not for a long time? i need to buy something for my daughter . 2)its the 5th day after surgery and i am still taking vicodin and if i forget to take it on time i feel i'm gonna die , tha pain is killing when will the pain go away? thank you for everything love u all

Posts.Content: May 4, 2011 07:43PM - edited May 4, 2011 07:44PM by melania Hi girls , I had my surgery yesterday and my only complain is the pain ,i also have some itchiness and i got benedryl and most of the time sleeping. The right side which was my cancer and lymphies are more painful than the other side. Ladies can u tell me how many days did it take for pathology results to come back? Although i did chemo and there is no tumor left i am concerned , there might be residual cells or lymph nodes . My skin around the nipple had small frickles and i was worried that it might be skin involvement or mets , the surgeon says she doent think so but if anything shows that the margins are not clean she can take a ittle but more, when we do mastectomy is this still possible not to have clean margins??? May be this is the skin that she was talking about. I am a ittle bit scared!
Posts.Title: April 2011 Masectomy IllinoisNancy Beaglesgirl

Posts.Content: May 17, 2011 01:33PM melania wrote: Ok ...I got my path report from surgery. It's not the best result thoug, after months of neoadjuvant chemo and having been told that the tumor and 3 lymph nodes disappeared in the scan , after surgery there was still just couples of residual cells in breast , but thank God the margins were clear, but there was still cancer in 3 lymph nodes and the biggest was 0.6 mm, I wish there wasnt any in lymph nodes , i will have rads and continuing on Herceptin. Is anybody out there with similar results ? I am really worried that i still had cancer in my body even after so many months going through chemo , any thoughts?? thanks

Posts.Title: help with pr erad CT scan melania redsox

Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2010 11:54PM melania wrote: I already got goosebumps about your son, of course u will be a survivor , you r already a survivor , sorry that u are here but be happy that u already know about it and let me tell u something when u get your report and go on with your treatments u will feel much better , i have been diagnosed just 2 months ago and i ahd the worst feeling at first and the most fear when i was doing the pet scan to see if its anywhere else in my body. I was also thinking its spreading everyday. I am living in CA and i am getting my treatments in the best cancer center in CA . I am doing chemo before surgery but i wanna do mastectomy anyways . I got 2 more opinions and they all agreed by doing chemo before surgery u can see the respond of the tumor by shrinkage and plus u can start the chemo as soon as possible without waiting for recovery after surgery and by doing so u can stop it from spreading ASAP. But again there are cases that they prefer to do the surgery first . And there are lots and lots of survivors who did so . Just remember to overcome your fears first and remember that u have to do whatever u can to be there for your kids . I have a 3 year old daughter and i am fighting just to be there for her with hair or no hair !

LOL !
